action: Use Public Transport Twice a Week
description: Delhi’s vehicles contribute nearly 40% of air pollution. Switching to metro or buses twice a week can cut your carbon footprint drastically.
Burning garbage releases toxic PM2.5 and CO gases. Dispose waste properly or compost organic matter at home.
Carpooling reduces traffic and pollution while saving fuel. Share rides with friends or colleagues during peak hours.
Native trees like Neem, Arjun, and Peepal absorb more carbon dioxide and improve Delhi’s air quality.
Plants like Areca Palm, Snake Plant, and Money Plant naturally filter air indoors and reduce PM2.5 levels.
Generators release harmful nitrogen oxides and particulate matter. Use inverter batteries or solar power as alternatives.
Switch off your engine at red lights. Idling for 10 minutes wastes fuel and emits as much pollution as 10 km of driving.
Composting kitchen waste reduces landfill methane emissions and produces natural fertilizer for plants.
Plastic bags and bottles clog drains and release microplastics. Carry cloth bags and metal bottles instead.

action: Switch to Clean Cooking Gas or Electric Stove
description: Using LPG or induction reduces smoke and black carbon emissions from traditional stoves.
Solar energy reduces dependency on coal-based electricity, one of Delhi’s major pollution sources.
Appliances with a 5-star BEE rating consume less power and reduce emissions from coal-based power plants.
Use ceiling fans or coolers when possible. ACs emit greenhouse gases and increase electricity demand during peak hours.
One Diwali night can spike Delhi’s AQI by 300–400 points. Choose eco-friendly celebrations instead.
Buying local reduces transportation emissions and supports sustainable agriculture in NCR.
